item.title: Report E-2023090622
item.description:
Report E-2023090622

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XIN experienced a UN1760 GF PHOS 417 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 150-gallons of material released to two areas of the concrete dock floor each measuring 20’ x 20’. The release was caused due to a forklift puncture. The remaining material in the tote was transferred into a new tote. Water was deployed to neutralize the impacted areas and absorbents were then used to collect all material. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (9) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023090265
item.description:
Report X-2023090265

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: NEW HAVEN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer was being unloaded before QA arrived. Unload manager made sure area was cleared and contacted QA once one was available. Spill was contained by absorbent pads and package was secured into a bagged tote to await processing. DescribePack: Cap of one bottle had fallen off. Cap looks intact so it may not have been secured before shipping. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent pads were used immediately to slow spread. Belt was stopped and other packages were held back to prevent contamination.

item.title: Report X-2023082037
item.description:
Report X-2023082037

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: LAFAYETTE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found leaking while unloading it from the trailer. It was sent to the QA cage, where it was placed in a hazmat tote until it could be processed. DescribePack: One bottle had a loose cap which caused contents to leak into pkg. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a hazmat tote.

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55 gallon drum of liquid powder clear (un1139) releasing 0.5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

Report E-2023090637

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55 gallon drum of liquid powder clear (un1179) releasing 0.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023081834
item.description:
Report X-2023081834

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET AND TORN. CONTENTS CONTAINED; 1 X 4 LITER PLASTIC BOTTLE OF UN1170 FLAMMABLE LIQUID. PACKAGE FAILED ENTIRELY DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF LOOSE BOTTLE CAPS. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.
